default.description: (white000: #FFFFFF) For default neutral backgrounds

default-hover.description: (#FAFAFA)For component hover states that use background/default

default-pressed.description: (#EBEBEB) For component pressed states that use background/default

alternative.description: (grey040: #F2F4F6) For a subtle contrast option for neutral backgrounds. (Example: backdrop, header background)

alternative-hover.description: (#EDEFF1) For component hover states that use background/alternative

alternative-pressed.description: (#DFE0E2) For component pressed states that use background/alternative

hover.description: (#00000005) For component hover states with no background color

pressed.description: (#00000014) For component pressed states with no background color

default.description: (grey800: #24272A) For general text that takes main priority in the information hierarchy

alternative.description: (grey600: #535A61) For a weaker contrast option for neutral text

muted.description: (grey200: #BBC0C5) For inactive or lowest priority text. (Example: placeholder)

default.description: (grey800: #24272A) For default neutral icons

alternative.description: (grey500: #6A737D) For a weaker contrast option for neutral icons

muted.description: (grey200: #BBC0C5) For inactive or lowest priority icons

default.description: (grey200: #BBC0C5) For default neutral borders with visible contrast. (Example: text inputs)

muted.description: (grey100: #D6D9DC) For a weaker contrast option for neutral borders. (Example: dividers)

default.description: (black000: #000000 60% opacity) For shading layers behind modality screens

alternative.description: (black000: #000000 80% opacity) For a stronger shading layer option behind modality screens

inverse.description: (white010: #FCFCFC) [DEPRECATED] overlay.inverse should be used only as the foreground element on top of overlay.default used for text or icons

default.description: (blue500: #0376C9) For primary user action related elements

alternative.description: (blue600: #0260A4) For the "pressed" state of interactive primary elements

muted.description: (blue500: #0376C9 10% opacity) For lowest contrast background used in primary elements

inverse.description: (white000: #FFFFFF) For elements used on top of primary/default. (Example: label of primary button, check in a checkbox)

disabled.description: (blue500: #0376C9 50% opacity) [DEPRECATED] primary.disabled should be used for all disabled primary action components such as buttons or links

default-hover.description: (#0379CE) For the "hover" state of interactive primary elements

default-pressed.description: (#036DB9) For the "pressed" state of interactive primary elements

default.description: (orange500: #F66A0A) [DEPRECATED] secondary.default should be used for any secondary actions. It should not be used for any negative connotations such as warnings or errors as it is quite closely tied to the MetaMask Fox

alternative.description: (orange600: #BF5208) [DEPRECATED] secondary.alternative should be used as an alternative to secondary.default for things such as hover states

muted.description: (orange500: #F66A0A 10% opacity) [DEPRECATED] secondary.muted is a very low contrasting secondary variant for things such as alert backgrounds. secondary.muted and secondary.inverse should not be used together in a foreground and background combination

inverse.description: (white010: #FCFCFC) [DEPRECATED] secondary.inverse should be used only as the foreground element on top of secondary.default and secondary.alternative. It is intended to be the most contrasting color to secondary.default. It should meet all AA and AAA accessibility standards such as the text or icon of a secondary button

disabled.description: (orange500: #F66A0A 50% opacity) [DEPRECATED] secondary.disabled should be used for all disabled secondary action components

default.description: (red500: #D73847) For high-level alert danger/critical elements. Used for text, background, icon or border

alternative.description: (red600: #B92534) For the "pressed" state of interactive danger/critical elements

muted.description: (red500: #D73847 10% opacity) For lowest contrast background used in high-level alert danger/critical elements. (Example: notification background)

inverse.description: (white000: #FFFFFF) For elements used on top of error/default (Example: label of danger/critical button)

disabled.description: (red500: #D73847 50% opacity) [DEPRECATED] error.disabled should be used for all disabled critical action components such as buttons

default-hover.description: (#CD4250) For the "hovered" state of interactive danger/critical elements

default-pressed.description: (#C63441) For the "pressed" state of interactive danger/critical elements

default.description: (orange600: #BF5208) For low-mid level alert elements. Used for text, background, icon or border

alternative.description: (yellow600: #FFC70A) [DEPRECATED] warning.alternative should be used as an alternative to warning.default for things such as hover states

muted.description: (orange600: #BF5208 10% opacity) For lowest contrast background used in warning elements. (Example: notification background)

inverse.description: (white000: #FFFFFF) For elements used on top of warning/default. Used for text, icon or border

disabled.description: (yellow500: #FFD33D 50% opacity) [DEPRECATED] warning.disabled should be used for all disabled component colors such as buttons

default-hover.description: (#C2540A) For the "hover" state of warning elements

default-pressed.description: (#A24507) For the "pressed" state of warning elements

default.description: (green500: #1C8234) For positive & good semantic elements. Used for text, background, icon or border

alternative.description: (green600: #1C8234) [DEPRECATED] (green600: #1C8234) success.alternative should be used as an alternative to success.default for things such as hover states

muted.description: (green600: #1C8234 10% opacity) For lowest contrast background used in success semantic. (Example: notification background)

inverse.description: (white000: #FFFFFF) For elements used on top of success/default. Used for text, icon or border

disabled.description: (green500: #28A745 50% opacity) [DEPRECATED] success.disabled should be used for all disabled success component colors such as buttons

default-hover.description: (#208838) For the "hover" state of success elements

default-pressed.description: (#1B7431) For the "pressed" state of success elements

default.description: (blue500: #0376C9) For informational semantic elements. Used for text, background, icon or border

alternative.description: (blue600: #0260A4) [DEPRECATED] info.alternative should be used as an alternative to info.default for things such as hover states

muted.description: (blue500: #0376C9 10% opacity) For lowest contrast background used in informational semantic. (Example: notification background)

inverse.description: (white000: #FFFFFF) For elements used on top of info/default. Used for text, icon or border

disabled.description: (blue500: #0376C9 50% opacity) [DEPRECATED] primary.disabled should be used for all disabled primary action components such as buttons or links

default.description: (blue400: #1098FC) For goerli test network

inverse.description: (white010: #FCFCFC) For elements used on top of networks/goerli/default. Used for text, icon or border

default.description: (grey200: #BBC0C5) For localhost test network

inverse.description: (white010: #FCFCFC) For elements used on top of networks/localhost/default. Used for text, icon or border

default.description: (violet300: #CFB5F0) For sepolia test network

inverse.description: (white010: #FCFCFC) For elements used on top of networks/sepolia/default. Used for text, icon or border

default.description: (purple500: #8B45B6) For Flask brand default colored elements.

inverse.description: (white010: #FCFCFC) For elements used on top of flask/default. Used for text, icon or border
